meta.name: AI Scarcity Infrastructure
meta.investment_role: Structural Growth + Scarcity Rents + Inflation/Real-Asset Hedge

north_star.core_bet: AI progress is constrained less by models and more by the physical stack (compute, memory, packaging, networking, datacenter power/cooling, grid interconnection), creating multi-year bottlenecks and scarcity rents for enabling supply chains.
north_star.portfolio_role: Own bottleneck owners across semis + power/grid + datacenter infrastructure, while managing rate sensitivity and crowding risk; use a multi-asset approach (equities core, commodities/rates/FX hedges, options/volatility structures) to reduce air-pocket risk.

structural_pillars.statement: AI capex remains elevated and persistent over 2â€“5 years (even if quarterly cadence fluctuates) because deployment is constrained by infrastructure availability rather than purely by demand whims.
structural_pillars.falsifiable_test: Top-5 hyperscaler aggregate capex is down >25% YoY for 4 consecutive quarters AND the decline is confirmed as demand destruction rather than supply timing.

structural_pillars.statement: Advanced packaging and grid procurement lead times remain multi-year, preventing rapid supply response and sustaining pricing power for constrained suppliers.
structural_pillars.falsifiable_test: Transformer/cable procurement lead times normalize back toward pre-2021 levels within 12 months, removing scarcity pricing power across grid equipment.

structural_pillars.statement: Power becomes the marginal constraint: datacenter load growth increasingly drives incremental electricity demand and related capex rather than being absorbed by existing grid slack.
structural_pillars.falsifiable_test: Datacenter electricity demand growth materially undershoots base-case trajectories due to structural stagnation (not timing shifts).

structural_pillars.statement: Scarcity rents accrue to enabling bottlenecks (HBM/memory, packaging, high-voltage equipment, thermal/cooling, networking) rather than being competed away across commoditized layers.
structural_pillars.falsifiable_test: Bottleneck pricing/margin evidence turns persistently negative (e.g., HBM pricing pressure reverses and remains falling) while capacity constraints are no longer described as binding by primary sources.

structural_pillars.statement: Policy and regulation remain investable: major jurisdictions do not impose persistent restrictions that materially block datacenter buildout or utility rate-base expansion without compensating mechanisms.
structural_pillars.falsifiable_test: Regulatory/permitting actions persistently block datacenter buildout or utility rate-base expansion without workable compensating mechanisms in major jurisdictions.

kill_criteria.condition: Hyperscaler AI/datacenter capex enters a sustained down-cycle (aggregate capex down >25% YoY for 4 consecutive quarters) AND the decline is confirmed as demand destruction rather than supply timing.

Key physical bottlenecks resolve materially faster than expected (e.g., transformer/cable procurement lead times normalize back toward pre-2021 levels within 12 months), removing scarcity pricing power across grid equipment.
Datacenter electricity demand growth materially undershoots base-case trajectories due to structural demand stagnation rather than timing shifts.

Real yields/rates rise to a regime that persistently crushes long-duration AI-infra equities without offsetting cash-flow capture (thesis becomes a pure multiple trade), unless the portfolio transitions to commodity/credit/short-duration expressions.

hedges_and_overlays: Index hedges and collar structures for crowded sleeves
excluded_vehicles: Unhedged long-duration exposure where the return driver is primarily multiple expansion rather than cash-flow capture
Commodity exposure without evidenced linkage to datacenter/grid build (no story metals without demand proof)
Illiquid/private exposures unless risk controls, governance, and drawdown tolerance are explicit
risk_constraints: Avoid paying priced-for-perfection multiples without an identifiable scarcity rent mechanism
Avoid unhedged long-duration exposure when the return driver is primarily multiple expansion
Manage rate sensitivity and crowding risk in high-multiple AI winners
Use multi-asset hedges (rates/FX/commodities) and options/volatility structures to manage air-pocket risk
Max 50% concentration in a single name within this sleeve
